Steve Ballmer on an endless loop. I could go on about what Chicago has over Seattle, but Seattlest's own Alex Hudson made the case for me last Friday. To wit: "We would like to get in on some of the sweet cultural action in the Windy City. For instance, we would like to have beluga whales at the aquarium, Van Goghs in the art museum and more than absolutely anything we would like to have a world class planetarium to blow our space-minds. We win, we get the space show. They win, they can have our far superior ballet company. On loan. " First, "sweet cultural action?" Project much?
